lines.text: You'll make a very impressive governor's husband, darling.
I got a pretty good education just growing up.
With her brain and education, she'd probably make a good governor, if she used her heart, too.
Charlie's been at City Hall for the past 30 years.
Really?
And Nick doesn't work either.
Politics is a sacred trust, not to be worn in one's hat like an adornment - nor in one's hip pocket as a blackjack!
When a gal from the top drawer invites a guy from the bottom drawer, she ain't lookin' to break even.
Beautiful women don't belong in politics.
Where do they belong?
Where do you think?
You'll try anything, won't you? Front door, back door, upstairs window if you can't get in any other way.
I've come to offer you a bribe.
That'll be my first this morning.
Yeah, I'm figurin' on a payoff.
Well, what is it?
A good long rest and a chance to go to heaven.
Your motives were wrong, your impulses unhealthy.
Never promise the voters more than they'll believe. On your record, I wouldn't believe you if you promised to become a woman.

[to Margaret]
I don't object to women in politics. I object to you in politics.

[after hearing herself on radio]
If you ever start to feel you've become important, just listen to your own voice.
Some of our best politicians have never read anything but the racing form.
